page.title: 03Fambridge Hall (2)
page.content: In the 16th century the house belonged to the Whitbread Family who were the Lords of the Manor. They built a new manor called White Notley Hall and Fambridge became a farm again. Today the farm has been sold and the house is now a family home. The house that stands today dates from several different times but the main part is from the late 18th century. The house is mainly lathe and plaster with only very small parts (the cellar and the chimneys) being of brick. Inside the house is on several different levels because of movement since it was built so some doors are a strange shape. The cellars were used for storing food to keep it cool in the days before fridges and freezers.
